medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral headaches, facial pain, bilateral neck and upper limb pain, complete loss of vision in the right eye, and acute partial loss of vision in the left eye.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The headache was of sudden onset in the temporal region, while left-sided peri-auricular pain and neck pain radiating to the arms were of slow onset. The temporal pain was continuous with an intensity of 5 to 6 on a visual analog scale (VAS) of 0 to 10 and had a throbbing quality. The visual symptoms were rapidly progressing, and the neck pain and pain radiating to the arms occurred intermittently, multiple times a day, with an intensity of 3 to 4. The temporal, TMJ, and ear pain were aggravated by chewing, and the neck and arm pain by neck movements. All symptoms were unresponsive to any past therapies. The patient reported claudication upon chewing, paresthesia in the neck and arm, and poor quality of sleep.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient is a known diabetic, hypertensive, and hyperlipidemic, all being managed adequately by medications.
